note.p: Birth: Booterstown, County Dublin, Ireland (22 October 1811)

Career: Assistant to his father; practised medicine, then gave it up; Keeper of Minerals, National Museum, Dublin (1867); Analyst to the Royal Dublin Society (1868); discovered thiocarbamide; Professor of Chemistry, Royal College of Surgeons, Dublin (1870); Professor of Chemistry, Trinity College, Dublin (1875); resigned (1903)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1920 vol 97 pp iii-vi signed by T E T
Notes: Proceedings gives death date as 17 February 1920
